FuncDef:
The ptp announce-interval command sets the interval at which a 1588v2 interface sends Announce packets.
The undo ptp announce-interval command restores the default interval.
The default interval at which a 1588v2 interface sends Announce packets is 128/1024s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval at which Announce packets are sent.
In 1588v2 mode, G.8275.1 mode, and CU-106 mode, the value is an integer ranging from 0 to 20. The default value is 7, which is 128/1024s. In SMPTE-2059-2 mode, the value ranges from 2 to 10, and the default value is 3.Table 1 lists the mapping between announce-interval values and actual intervals.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Two devices exchange Announce packets to determine the master/slave relationship. The master device sends Sync packets to notify the slave device of time signal parameters and uses a delay measurement mechanism to achieve time signals accuracy.
Precautions
Two devices exchange Announce packets to determine the master/slave relationship. The master device sends Sync packets to notify the slave device of time signal parameters and uses a delay measurement mechanism to achieve time signals accuracy.
